p: Mycorrhizal colonization was demonstrated following Phillips and Hayman [ 21]. About 0.5 g of fresh roots were clarified with potassium hydroxide (10% w/ v) and potassium hydroxide (10%) + hydrogen peroxide (10% v/ v) in a ratio of 1:1 ( v/ v), then stained with 0.05% trypan blue in lactoglycerol. A stereomicroscope (40Ã—) was used to show the stained roots, while the colonization rate was calculated by using gridline intersect method [ 22].
